alert.note: Alert for Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 10:36PM EDT until July 21 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Central Ohio, Fayette OH. In South Central Ohio, Highland. In Southwest Ohio, Clinton. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Extending from near Lees Creek to Leesburg through much of the Rattlesnake Creek drainage. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Greenfield, Leesburg, Highland, East Monroe, New Martinsburg, Lees Creek and Paint Creek State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
